users.name: GreatUKGovTweets
users.description: Using data to highlight great UK government communication, from @measuredvoice.

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Keep highlighting poor performance by our regulators Feargal. We love our countryside and our rivers and we appreciate everything you do.... there is an army behind you!

Meanwhile back in the real world the @EnvAgency have applied for an abstraction licence.

Why? To pump water from the aquifer into a river that is, wait for it, wait for it, over abstracted by the water industry.  You can't make this sh*t up.

PS, the river is also full of it. https://t.co/1xdVY2Ozhc https://t.co/uN3GBq4qiL

urls.title: Government to let farmers use bee-killing pesticide banned by EU
urls.description: ‚ÄòWe need urgent action to restore the abundance of our insect populations, not broken promises that make the ecological crisis even worse,‚Äô says Wildlife Trusts

tweets.text:
Government to let farmers use bee-killing pesticide banned in EU https://t.co/s2sfcFneSZ

Is this a joke @BIGGALtd  @golfenvawards @EnvAgency how the hell can they justify this @CtcCraig @headlandpete @indigrowuk @SyngentaTurfUK @symbiofin @ICL_Turf @EnglandGolf must be stopped

@DefraGovUK @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @williamrworsley @ForestryEngland What a meaningless, pathetic thing to say-just when we hear about the bee killing pesticide that is being allowed now that there is no EU 'regulation'? urls.description: If you have a flooding emergency please contact Oxfordshire Fire and Rescue Service on 999. Oxfordshire Fire and Rescue Service‚Äôs main responsibility is saving lives, property and the environment. They will also support other agencies to alleviate flooding as part of a joined up approach as can be seen below. During a flooding incident you [‚Ä¶]

Quagga mussels are an invasive non-native species and have recently been found in the #RiverTrent.

They can spread rapidly and block pipes.

Help us prevent this: check, clean and dry your equipment and footwear after spending time around watercourses.

@Parrog3 @EnvAgencyAnglia @AffinityWater @AquiferChalk @OliverHealdUK Nothing lives when there‚Äôs no water. The upper reaches of the Ivel are biologically dead. It needs water all year round every year. The EA have a significant part to play in mandating this. @AquiferChalk @AffinityWater @EnvAgency @OliverHealdUK

@EnvAgencyAnglia Whilst this is a lovely story, your water resources department have let @AffinityWater drain the upper Ivel completely dry for months this year. A dry river is a dead river. How about a whole catchment approach to looking after the Ivel?  @IvelRev @AquiferChalk @OliverHealdUK

urls.title: DM168 Environment: Miners are ripping up the West Coast
urls.description: Long stretches of pristine coastline are being affected by mining enterprises. So surfer Mike Schlebach and others have formed an organisation to protect the area‚Äôs beaches, dunes and biodiversity.

tweets.text: South Africa‚Äôs Ministry of Enviromental Affairs has granted mining permissions to an Australian company to dig up pristine beaches along the West Coast. Tonmin and other companies like them are unlikely to receive such permissions in their homeland  https://t.co/J2WgH9AFX5
